content: Haha. Good question. Since I work on a package manager, getting in on the ground floor of the work being done here is one thing I had in mind - even though I know the current build situation doesn't really transfer to a proper release.
The other thing is - being a big Rust fan, and having the hardware for other purposes, I wanted to see if there's anything I can do to pitch in to help.
Does Homebrew have many packages that require Rust? I saw y'all linked to our tracking issue.
Yeah, at this point there's over 100 packages that need Rust to build.
Neat! I'm guessing that's still a small percentage though.
That could be one way to help out — how easy would it be for you to see if those packages build with the Rust compiler you just built?
Probably wouldn't run any of their tests or anything, but something > nothing.
Probably not too hard. In Homebrew it'd be slightly weirder but it's probably not impossible to manually turn this Rust I built into a Homebrew install that Homebrew thinks it built itself
Or I can just use that as a list of things to build manually
I'd do whatever is easier; this isn't an important thing to do.
